When canceling during the resolution phase (and before the size dialog is shown), the following NPE occurs:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.ui.dialogs.UpdateWizardPage.getSize(UpdateWizardPage.java:73)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.ui.dialogs.UpdateWizardPage.makeElements(UpdateWizardPage.java:46)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.ui.dialogs.ProfileModificationWizardPage$1.run(ProfileModificationWizardPage.java:83)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:119)


I got this when looking for update.
Steps:
- in the admin user ui, expand a profile
- select "check for updates" and while the resolution is going on hit "cancel"
Also the size dialog is being presented but it should not

There is a quick and dirty way I could fix this for M4 if desired.  What do you think?

A better fix is to:
- either return the returned phase set status or throw an exception from the ProvisioningUtil method so that the nature of the error is known.
- fix up the code so that the resolving/sizing happens before the wizard even opens (see also bug #208294).

I think this should be fixed in the context of a bunch of other M5 bugs:
bug #208294 and all the ones it discusses....
